name: 5-bromo-2-nitropyridine
Reason: 5-bromo-2-nitropyridine has a basic unit of pyridine, which has a melting point of 106°C. The bromine atom increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the formation of π-π stacking interactions with other molecules. The nitro group also contributes to the melting point due to its electron-withdrawing nature, which can increase the intermolecular interactions and rigidity. The [N+](=O)[O-] group can also participate in hydrogen bonding, which can further increase the melting point. The total contribution to the melting point can be estimated as follows: pyridine base (106°C), bromine (20°C), and nitro group (10°C).
